alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Grant; Jackson; La Salle; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 3:52PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Grant, Caldwell, southeastern Jackson, southeastern Natchitoches, La Salle, southeastern Ouachita and Winn Parishes through 445 PM CDT... At 350 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary ahead of a broken line of thunderstorms along a line extending from near Holly Ridge to near Columbia to 11 miles northwest of Olla to 9 miles northeast of Montgomery. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 to 50 mph possible along the outflow boundary. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Winnfield, Columbia, Swartz, Ball, Jena, Richwood, Colfax, Olla, Clarks, Montgomery, Grayson, Midway, Urania, Natchez, Pollock, Dry Prong, Tullos, Dodson and Georgetown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for north central and northwestern Louisiana.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Grant; Jackson; La Salle; Natchitoches; Ouachita; Winn
